thread.title: Fiction Chronicle: Folly and Madness in Exquisite Counterpoint

author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: Folly and Madness in Exquisite Counterpoint
text: Lisa Halliday’s debut, “Asymmetry” (Simon & Schuster, 275 pages, $26), a brilliant and complex examination of power dynamics in love and war, begins by redressing a longstanding imbalance in the world of fiction. The novel introduces Alice, a 25-year-old editorial assistant who enters into a relationship with a randy old writer named Ezra Blazer, a multiple National Book Award winner with an international following. In countless books by a pride of literary lions from Saul Bellow to John Updike to Philip Roth, vacuous young mistresses have served as symbols of erotic salvation for the aging men who command our attention....
